title: Madaline Witort
text:

     LinkedIn
  
  
    
     Email
  




Madaline Witort
Currently, a senior at Case Western Reserve University graduating with Bachelor’s of Arts in Communication Science and Disorders and Cognitive Science as well as a graduate certificate in Clinical and Translational Research from the School of Medicine. I teach yoga classes to the CWRU Yoga club and greater Cleveland Community and typically read about two books a month. Luckily, my time management is always on par!
As a dedicated research scientist with over four years spent understanding brain injury and transnational research, my career is defined by moving scientific discoveries across the research continuum to improve patient outcomes. I am adept at literature reviews to understand gaps in the current literature as well as using biostatistics to model these findings. My work has culminated into my first plenary speaker presentation: “Smarter After the Smack: What My Traumatic Brain Injury Taught Me About Diagnosising Yours” at the Brain Injury Conference of Pennsylvania June of 2025.
Not only am I an aspiring research scientist, but I am a mentor. In my role as a mentor for the PubMed Healthcare Analytics Program I mentored a cohort of seven undergraduate students ranging from bio-medical engineering students, pre-health students and pre-law students. I aim to continue to ask research questions that have measurable patient outcomes. I am committed to improving the statistical quality of research and believe in the power of interdisciplinary research to solve health challenges.
On this website, you will find a selection of my published works, including scholarly articles, You will also find news and updates on my current research projects, as well as information on upcoming events and conferences where I will be speaking. I invite you to explore my website. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential projects.

title: Projects
text: In fall of 2024, I began to teach self leadership yoga classes sponsored by the Marian K. Shaughnessy Nurse Leadership Academy (MKSNLA). These classes are meant to give students space in your day to improve your own physical wellness and consequently improve how you see yourself as a leader and changemaker in the community.

title: Projects
text: In fall of 2024, I began to teach self leadership yoga classes sponsored by the Marian K. Shaughnessy Nurse Leadership Academy (MKSNLA). These classes are meant to give students space in your day to improve your own physical wellness and consequently improve how you see yourself as a leader and changemaker in the community.

title: Projects
section: Yoga and Meditation Class with CWRU Sky Meditation
text:
Yoga and Meditation Class with CWRU Sky Meditation









In the fall of 2024, CWRU Yoga Club partnered with the SKY meditation club for the first time to offer the community a free one hour vinyasa class and meditation. SKY Meditation is a unique breath-based technique that uses cyclical, rhythmic patterns of breath to bring the mind and body effortlessly into meditation. This technique is a great way for anyone to deep their toes into meditation. I look forward to expanding my yoga teaching beyond vinyasa style classes to incorporate restorative breathing.
